p: Another example presents a library of β-pinene-based thiazole derivatives 88 ( Figure 20) [ 82]. The obtained compounds were evaluated for their antitumor in vitro activities, and the results demonstrated that most target compounds showed potent antiproliferative activities against three human cancer cell lines. Especially, compound 4-(2-(2-(6,6-dimethyl-3-(4-nitrobenzylidene)bicyclo[3.1.1] heptan-2-ylidene)hydrazinyl)thiazol-4-yl)phenol (R 1 = NO 2, R 2 = OH) displays excellent cytotoxic activity against Hela, CT-26, and SMMC-7721 cell lines with IC 50 values of 3.48, 8.84, and 6.69 μM, respectively. These findings indicated that thiazole with a hydroxyl group attached to the phenyl group is favorable for increasing anticancer activity.
